did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Warren County (Va.) Road and Bridge Records, Volume 1, 1836-1875
did.physloc: State Records Center - Archives Annex, Library of Virginia

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Warren County (Va.) Road and Bridge Records, Volume 1, 1836-1875. Local government records collection, Warren County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from Warren County and Accession 37021.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Warren County was named for Joseph Warren, the revolutionary patriot who sent Paul Revere and William Dawes on their famous rides and who was killed at the Battle of Bunker Hill. The county was formed from Frederick and Shenandoah counties in 1836.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Warren County (Va.) Road and Bridge Records, Volume 1, 1836-1875 is a list of roads and Surveryors of Roads in Warren County. There is an index in this book.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Warren County Court can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"
